review: First of all...it's pretty tiny.  About the size of two decks of cards laying next to each other.  It was a BREEZE to hook up and set up.I've used it a lot so far and I'm so glad I bought it.  the picture is crystal clear, haven't had a single issue of pixelation or buffering yet.  I do wish it had HBO Go on it but, after reading the announcement that Prime will be given some of HBO's older content to stream, I'm pretty sure the HBO Go app will be along soon.I also wish the voice command worked across all apps but, it only works for Prime.  Not a huge issue for me, though.I haven't played any games yet.  I opened up the Sev Zero game and poked around a bit but, I'm awful at shooter games so I'll have to wait for my 20 year old son to get his hands on it.  lolAll in all, I'm very happy with this purchase!
author: Cheryl D

review: If you have no sense of hearing, this box is great, been battling loss of sound with Netflix and Hulu for several days now, the voice command only works for Amazon Prime which is far below average, at least the remote works, I only have negative reviews of this substandard product

review: So easy to connect to the t.v., really just as easy as the computer, but the Fire TV is so small that it fits right there with the TV. I can watch my prime shows and my niece can play the games all on the same unit. Only problem I see is if we want to use at the same time. Able to access NetFlix and Hulu with touch of remote.

review: This is a great little device.
